column4: Hello, I want to use free Java tools with Ubuntu. I already noticed that sable-vm can be used as a virtual machine. But which Java compiler should I use?
isn't gcj the least buggy free java?
but can gcj ouput .class files instead of native code?

oh ok, didn't know that. I have always used the Sun VM, but wanted to try the free tools too. Guess Mono's got an advantage here, since MS .NET isn't available for Linux while Sun's VM is. The classpath hackers certainly deserve some respect too ;-)
I did try jikes, but it could't find the class library... Maybe gcj will automatically find the library :-) Damn I'm spoiled...
what are you using java for, as a matter of interest?
I suppose most existing jdk-1.4 programs won't run with the free tools?
not unless they were written specially to work with them
which Java version is _completely_ supported? Rewriting Eclipse to get it running on gcj kind of defeats the purpose of free java VM's and compilers.
jikes needs a separate JRE to work, I believe
I am using sun's JDK, not GCJ, so I can't really comment on spec files and suchlike.
no problem, I think I'll return to Sun's too for now..
hopefully the GCJ thing is just a packaging problem, but at least the sun stuff works.
thanks for your help. I'm off now, bye!
